item.title: Why do people on this board whine piss and moan about having six-figs? — 32 replies — 128.0/hr
item.content:encoded:
Why do people on this board whine piss and moan about having six-figs?

Open thread • Replies: 32 • Updated: 2026-02-21 23:45 UTC

OP

Do any of you realize how unbelievably lucky you are compared against most in even 1st-world countries? Your average person is tens of thousands in credit card debt and struggling to pay off their klarna these days. Even worse, they're a few months behind on their mortgage and about to lose their house.

Meanwhile, your lot go "WAAAAAA WOE IS ME I'M ONLY WORTH $475K AT 23 YEARS OLD I'LL NEVER BE RICH!!!!!" Even if you're larping, I mean fuck you don't' realize how spoiled rotten and ridiculous you sound, you're not even funny nor cute when you whine like that.

Early replies (first 3)

61883852
>>61883830
yea but crypto went down

61883873
>>61883830
because im still a wageslave you retarded cockgargling faggot

61883874
>>61883830
There are no 1st world countries anymore. It goes:

Switzerland, Northern Italy, Poland, and everybody else

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61883875
>>61883830
>$475K AT 23 YEARS OLD
Peanuts, when 1 out of 10 murricans are millionaires.

not all of us want to retire in SEA, anon.

61883906
>>61883830
I'm a loser and don't have shit to invest.

I just come here to pretend I'll have some money someday. I know I won't, though.

61883913
>>61883873
You weigh at least 300 lbs of pure blubber behind that keyboard I imagine.
>>61883875
Skewed statistic that also counts people's net worth in their sole homes' equity. They don't have that in liquid cash and could still lose their home to ridiculous bullshit like high interest mortgage missed payments, taxes, etc.

Besides, that misses the main point I'm making; with six-figs in net worth or better yet liquid cash, you're WAY better off than your average burger/cancuck/etc. I'm saying that you should appreciate your blessed life and quit whining when you very well could've ended up on the streets with massive debt that'll never be paid off instead or even worse, be born in Hait/Congo/etc.

61883922
because 6 figures is nothing

61883931
>>61883830
6 fig net worth is literally nothing because that includes all your property

61883934
>>61883922
It's only "nothing" when you want to live in say East Cobb Georgia or the Hamptons for example, or if you have extremely dogshit budgeting skills.

BUT if you say have a family of several kids, yeah of course you'd still struggle with low-mid six figures, understandable on that end at least.

61883943
>>61883830
Are you actually retarded?
At a $115k salary and $230k in assets I don't qualify for a mortgage in the area I live in.
>inb4 just move
My job isn't going to move with me to bumfuck nowhere. Everyone is entitled to not being priced out of the home they grew up in.

61883953
>>61883943
You don't qualify for a mortgage either because your credit sucks or credit is simply razor thin generally speaking right now - banks are hesitant to give out loans at sky high housing interest rates and also le economic uncertainty plays into that too.

Besides that, you must like in a ultra HCOL area if you still don't qualify with over $200k.

61883959
>>61883830
If you weren't part of the top 10% in 2025, you're lower class

61883985
>>61883830
I dont care about other people. 200k is not enough to retire and thats the only thing that matters. I need to get out of this rat race as soon as possible.

61884033
>>61883953
800 credit score, no debt, and COL for my area is equivalent to the national average COL.

What's the new cope? How do you shift the goal posts from here?

61884099
>>61883830
>"Your average person is tens of thousands in credit card debt and struggling to pay off their klarna these days"

ive watched enough caleb hammer videos on youtube to not give a single fuck about debt slave niggers anymore. Not only that, but you dumb fuck niggers bring it upon yourselves. You retards belong in a mental hospital.

now.
enjoy living in the hell you created for yourself nigger

61884107
>>61883830
>Your average person
I don't care about them.

61884123
>>61883830
They want to be millionaires so that they can live off of the dividends. Six figures doesn't generate enough to live on, so you have to keep that six figures in more volatile assets. You need to keep waging, and you need to hold stuff that could drop 20% in a day. It's mentally exhausting.

61884124
>>61884033
So you have over 800 credit score and over 200k in assets and you still don't qualify for a mortgage in a average cost of living area? Something doesn't add up about your story, or do you have something to hide (like a larp?)

61884133
>>61884123
Fair enough, finally a reasonable detailed response to my thread.

61884178
>>61884124
Does anything that disproves your world view count as a larp to you? The reality of many Americans is the same as what I've said.
>but it could be worse
No shit, that doesn't mean we have to be content with how dogshit the market is right now you JIDF fag.

61884587
>>61883830
Yeah but the jews

61884630
I used to have a crypto portfolio worth $300k and now I have a negative NW. I would do anything to go back in time and put it all in boomer ETFs. I might not be able to quit working but life would exponentially easier. I fucked up badly and I know it.

61884639
>>61883830
100k and below is loser class.
150k is middle class.

61884645
Is getting the first 100k really the point when your wealth starts to snowball higher? I forget where I heard that opinion.

61884650
>>61884645
100k. Maybe back then.
It is probably 1m now.

61884652
>>61883830
Because 6 figs is nothing and still incel tier, I want to be chad rich tier and never have to work again

61884658
>>61884652
Come join us in the neet thread

61884755
>>61883830
Nigga I aint free until I can be free from the cage forever

61884765
>>61884755
You are kinda free if you are in the top 10% ig. They are the group still spending in usa.

61884780
>>61883830
Another day another poorfag trying to drag me into his crab bucket.

FUCK OFF YOU PIECE OF SHIT LOSER STOP TRYING TO MAKE EVERYONE SUFFER WITH YOU

61884789
>>61884780
He isn’t wrong. American median household income is 60k.

61885028
>>61883830
Six figs isnt enough to retire. Anyways Im at very low 6 figs one slight dump in stocks and Im back to 5 figure hell.

I want out of the wagecage and its not luck when the average person in the US probably buys fast food 10 times a week, goes out to a restuarant once a week at $200 per visit.

61885045
it called being tongue-and-cheek you stupid fucking retarded fucking nigger

>>61884958
Just need a 7x then I'm good. Already have rope if ready if I don't reach the goal in 5 years

61884967
>>61884958
i have about 3m networth but haven't quit my job yet. making too much money but want to quit real bad. i took a 4 day weekend recently and got bored because i have no life and hobbies because my job dominates my life and i have no energy left over to develop my personal life after work.

>>61884958

61884974
>>61884968
Thailand, Vietnam, Malaysia, Albania, is what I got so far.

61884976

61884979
>>61884967
They've done an excellent job of trapping you, anon.

61884983
>>61884958
I'm back to ramen noodle mode.
I WILL make this savings last until I get a job again.

61884986

61884996
>>61884974

61884999
>>61884976
>>61884986
I listened to a Grant Cardone video on YouTube about pulling IRA retirement money into self-directed fund then you can use it to buy real estate without getting the penalty but you have to go big and do multi-dwelling unit or else IRS flags you. I'm too chicken shit to try it (yet) but if you're going to an hero anyway fuck it try it
>pull life retirement savings
>buy 10 unit apartment building
>give self job fixing toilets
>collect rent from tenants
>profit

61885003
ok maybe a 3 unit building

61885030
>>61884999
You literally cannot fix the toilets yourself. Under IRC §4975 you are considered a "disqualified" person. Basically you can own it but you can never touch it. Very gay way to 'own' something.

item.content:encoded:
insider here, again.

Open thread • Replies: 17 • Updated: 2026-02-21 23:20 UTC

OP

i hope you bought BBBY-WT BBBY-WARRANTS

Early replies (first 3)

61879648
I have a few thousand of these along with shares what am I in for

61879767
>>61879648
getting dumped on by OP

61879836
>>61879767
Due to my current occupation, I am prohibited from holding stocks, options, or similar investments.

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61879895
This you?

61879921
>>61879767
idk I mean bed bath was once a huge American retail darling...the historic overstock chart is super schizo/presently quite low...these warrants are trading like a shitcoin which is funny...I also don't dislike lemonis. He's a media player and if you actually listened to some of his shit there does seem to be an interesting intersection between blockchain capabilities and homeownership etc...not financial advice of course just a variety of things I was peeking at when researching

61879944
>>61879263
no

61879999
>>61879836
What is your current occupation anon? Nothing revealing but in general etc...the exercise price of the warrants is $15...trading currently at less than a dollar it seems like a confusing deal...at this point if one likes the company wouldn't shares be the move? I did some modeling around warrant prices if the shares price goes to xyz and that is very interesting...also speaking of interesting what's the deal with the alleged cusip similarity to the old bbbyq shares?

61880091
>>61879999
Financial system. I am not asking you to hold those warrants until they are exercised. I am asking you to hold them and sell the warrants when we can realize a substantial profit. Nice quads.

61881477
>>61880091
Interesting. Wouldn't trading the warrants implicitly come with a short term capital gains tax insofar as its impossible to hold them over a year at this point? Would have to be some pretty fair gains to offset that 40% hit...anyways doesn't the warrants increasing in price also imply that the shares have gone up in price as well? I ran some informal modeling estimates using black scholes with iv, roughly .65 years to expiry and this is what I came up with: 15.5 bbby share price = 4.50ish warrant price...25 share price/12ish warrant price...60 share price/45ish warrant price...100 share price/85ish warrant price...200 share price 185ish warrant price...I make no claim as to the veracity of these numbers, just for fun. Anyways what do you see happening to the bbby stock price for these warrants to be worthwhile? Am I thinking on the right track in general?

61881670
>>61879263

61881753
>>61879999
>>61881477
note the digis

61881916
>>61879263
Buy these if you want, but remember, these warrants are not related to the canceled BBBYQ/DK-Butterfly, reguardless of what the BBBYQ schizos say.

61881980
>>61881916

61882152
>>61879263

>>61878148

61878160
>>61878155

61878162
>>61878109
They made a bet that reaching out infrastructure to the hundreds of millions of people of low-productivity regions could improve domestic demand to the extent that their subsidies start to be consumed internally. The problem is that the low-productivity areas are, of course, low income and the only two options which exist to them are:
>Direct UBI for low-income areas
>Creating even more highly subsidized factories to employ low-income people and give them a better wage
Honestly for them the UBI route is likely more cost-effective, to avoid further deflating the value of the plants they already have. The 3rd (much) more challenging and expensive option would be to migrate the sweat-shops and low-skill factories out to the countryside from bigger city centers and reassign the existing factories to high-tech, high-skill plants such as chip foundries and advanced component manufacturing. To a certain extent they're being forced into this already due to sanctions etc on high-end chips, but if it's their primary gameplan then it's progressing way too slowly. Modernizing a billion people (bugs) is a hell of a project

61878168
>>61878160
You're stinking up the thread.

61878171
>>61878162
>UBI
That's the funny part, the polity as the bureaucracy as the socialist "billionaire" bastards that rely on the continuation of the sovereign bond ponzis are going to hang on the same gallows

61878316
>>61878171
Are you ESL? I feel like I got schizophrenia just from reading your post

61880069
>>61874731
>17% of the US population who are hooked on SSRIs get their supplies cut off, along with the active ingredients we buy from them for everything else. We lost the bio-warfare game before it even began.

61880124
>>61875629
Everything done by a government can be construed as being a subsidy

Good infrastructure is a subsidy
Skilled workforce is a subsidy
Low crime rate is a subsidy
Friendly regulatory environment is a subsidy
Low cost of living for employees is a subsidy
Ease of worker relocation and efficient job matching is a subsidy
Low taxes due to government thrift is a subsidy
Etc

61880265
>>61873120
On the world though? Also where would China be without Amazon and Walmart like worse than Thailand.

61880291
>>61875302
>If a basket of various goods in the US goes for 100 dollars and that same basket of goods in Vietnam goes for 10 dollars (ALL ELSE BEING EQUAL), then a fair exchange rate would be 10 dong for one dollar
That is a made up rule. There is no fundamental reason for why 1 dong should have the same purchasing power as 1 dollar. Currency units are just made up. Vietnam could introduce a new currency superunit called the bong, say 1 bong is equal to 25,970 dong and also that 1 bong is equal to 1 dollar. That would satisfy your rule while also de facto maintaining the current exchange rate.

There is a natural reason for why the basket is cheaper in dollar terms in Vietnam, which is the Balassa-Samuelson effect

>There’s a reason why economists or even someone casually interested in the economy and trade policy use these terms.
Yes, because they are shills trying to find arguments for why China should make Chinese companies less competitive and/or arguments for why tariffs should be imposed against China. It's really all just to protect the profits of domestic companies

61880312
>>61880291
>say 1 bong is equal to 25,970 dong and also that 1 bong is equal to 1 dollar.
*say 1 bong is equal to 2,597 dong and also that 10 bong are equal to 1 dollar

61880533
>>61880291
>my rule
>it’s literally just the most basic economics
Listen, I can’t explain exchange rates to you any more than I already have. Believe whatever you want. If you want to believe that exchange rates do not affect exporters or importers, go for it. It’s of no consequence to me if you sound retarded.

61880545
>>61880069
>leftists kill themselves en masse after their meds run out leading to a 100 year Republican dynasty
Still not seeing the downside

61880558
>>61880545
The downside is that the mentally sound people are not going to just off themselves. They are going to take it out on everyone around them like they normally do.

61880563
>>61880558
mentally ill*
Ultimately its going to be an improvement.

61880603
>>61880533
It's not "basic economics".

Fiat currency units are arbitrary. Fiat currencies have no inherent or fair value because they aren't tied to anything real.

>If you want to believe that exchange rates do not affect exporters or importers
That's not what I was saying

61880653
>>61880603
>>61875302
Again, a currency does not have to have an underlying physical asset in order to have value in relation to something else. I’m not sure why you think it does.

This is not my pet theory. It’s just basic economics. Just look into Purchasing Power Parity, and if you don’t get it, that’s fine. Again, you can believe whatever you want. I’ve done my due diligence.

61880707
Give it to me straight: Has China already won? It seems to be doing better than the west.

61880739
>>61880653
I'm not saying a fiat currency can't have value relative to something else. I'm saying it does not have an inherent or fair value, and therefore it cannot be undervalued or overvalued.

When I said a fiat currency is not tied to anything real, I meant that it's not backed by anything real fixed at any specific predetermined ratio. I did not mean that it cannot be exchanged for anything real.

I'm familiar with PPP, and there is no reason why it should be the exchange rate.

61880750
>>61873505
currency you nigger, currency, not money.

61880812
>>61880739
> I'm saying it does not have an inherent or fair value, and therefore it cannot be undervalued or overvalued.
It can be in relation to something else.
If one dong can buy a bicycle in Vietnam, and a dollar can buy a bicycle in the US, and this 1:1 ratio roughly carries across a multitude of good, and Vietnam’s nominal exchange rate for USD is 100:1, the currency is undervalued. It is worth much more than the nominal exchange rate suggests. Its real value *in relation to the US dollar* is higher than its nominal value.
> there is no reason why it should be the exchange rate.
It is not the exchange rate. It is a factor in the exchange rate. The reason makes sense.

It is important to understand that we are talking about managed exchange rates here, and it’s much more obvious in these examples. Many economists also think that currencies can be undervalued/overvalued even if both currencies float freely.

61880827
>>61872964
As if China will give a shit.

61880935
>>61880707
Yes, considering where all the gold and silver is going.

61882682
>>61872964
Jews have no power in China

61883413
What is even supposed to be illegal about a government subsidizing a critical infrastructure industry and innovation?

>government spends trillion dollars on nigger welfare with negative ROI
or
>government spends trillion on energy, housing, vehicles with long term national benefits

who the fuck decides what a country can spend their tax income from?

61883573
>>61883413
To be fair, the IMF is calling on them to do this, at least partially, for their own interest.

Part of their problem is that they’re overproducing and flooding the market with goods and it’s pissing everyone off. So the IMF is essentially warning them there could be market retaliation. This falls in line with what you’re saying and maybe they should just fuck off.

The second reason though is that by overproducing so much, they’re making their deflation problem worse. They’ve long struggled with falling prices.

It’s a bit of a conundrum for them. If they stop subsidizing and overproducing, workers lose jobs. But if they don’t stop overproducing, prices continue to fall
and other countries might tariff more, which would only generate more unsold goods at home, which results in falling prices and falling wages/lost jobs.

item.title: The XRP community are finally catching onto Ripples grift — 8 replies — 11.7/hr
item.content:encoded:
The XRP community are finally catching onto Ripples grift

item.title: Is it even possible to make it by opening a traditional business anymore? — 18 replies — 8.2/hr
item.content:encoded:
Is it even possible to make it by opening a traditional business anymore?

Open thread • Replies: 18 • Updated: 2026-02-21 21:39 UTC

OP

Read subject

Is it even possible? Not only do you have to jump through a million regulations and fees just to get started, you're also competing against trillion dollar mega corps who can and will undercut you because they employ ten thousand indians and illegals who work for pennies. Even traditional blue collar jobs like plumbers and HVAC are all slowly coagulating into one single corporate entity (in my area), and basically every single mom and pop store was killed during COVID.

It seems like the only way you can actually achieve anything is to basically trick angle investors into giving your bullshit tech start-up a ton of money or getting really lucky and have an app you make be bought out by a megacorp so they can rape your customers to death.

Pic unrelated

Early replies (first 3)

61881446
>>61881439

Step 2: have her start an ASMR channel on YouTube
Step 3: have her start a merchandise line on shopify
There.

Even trillion dollar companies can't do everything. The amount of bureaucracy involved to manage such a large entity is limiting in its own ways.
You have to find a niche that isn't currently being served in your market and then create a business for that.
For example: nobody is making catgirl gfs right now, it's a completely untapped market.

61884346
>>61881439
Welcome to the patent system!
* invent something new under the sun
* spend a few thousand dollars with a patent attorney to protect your invention in an airtight manner
* sue the shit out of anyone who infringes
* make outsized profits on everything you sell

I vaguely remember being told by one of my patent law professors during law school that over 80% of profits in the U.S. are tied to intellectual property, i.e., patents and copyrights. Commodity goods just aren't profitable when you have to compete by selling as close to zero margin as you can get, and make it up on volume.

A company called Rare Breed is doing that right now in the field of "forced reset trigger systems" for firearms. Their projections are that they will make mid-eight figures of profit annually if they are the sole source. Note "profit" not "revenue". Manufacturing costs on each of their units is probably around $50, and they're selling them for $500 each.

The difficulty: lots of infringers, including one batshit insane asshole from Arizona, and one kid who designed a free one that anyone can 3D print at home. (And in all fairness, the kid put it out on free 3D printing websites before several of Rare Breed's patents issued, but after they were filed, so he arguably wasn't even infringing at the time.) They've got something like seventeen lawsuits going right now, IIRC, and some of the defendants are trying to get their cases consolidated into a single trial because of the expense.

61884359
It's like getting into the in-game market in an MMO that's been around for 20 years, it's completely futile
